name: A Weekend at Sullivan's
description: Cead mile failte! Fair Haven is a place where everyone is a friend. Tom Paris' laid-back holoprogram is seeing widespread use across the Federation running on a unique new technology. But is this idyllic hamlet on the verge of becoming a nightmare?
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Federation, Klingon, and Ferengi Alliance Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Paris, O'Halloran, Sullivan, Kim, Costumed, or Romantic crew will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Paris, O'Halloran, Sullivan, Kim, Costumed, Romantic
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Stavos
featured_crew.flavor: The fourth clone of a genetic scientist obsessed with establishing peace throughout the galaxy.

action.name: It Is Not Just A Duplicate

featured_crew.name: O'Halloran
featured_crew.flavor: A woman from the Fair Haven holoprogram who works at a vegetable stand. Tom Paris fell in love with her during one of his visits.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Stavos
rewards.flavor: The fourth clone of a genetic scientist obsessed with establishing peace throughout the galaxy.

adventures.name: Nestled Away
adventures.description: Disconnect Fair Haven from external holodecks and suites.

adventures.name: Wanderlust
adventures.description: Retrieve holograms that have roamed into other programs.

adventures.name: The Way Things Are
adventures.description: Integrate the new and old data into Fair Haven.

rewards.name: A Weekend at Sullivan's
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: O'Halloran
rewards.flavor: A woman from the Fair Haven holoprogram who works at a vegetable stand. Tom Paris fell in love with her during one of his visits.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "Welcome to Sullivan's, what'll it be? Whiskey? Port? Bloodwine? Or perhaps you'd like to amuse yourself with our ring toss? Or maybe our dabo spin?"

"Well, Captain, whaddya think? I'm trying a little experiment. The Doc and I have been working on a holo server that hosts a holoprogram from one location, but allows modifications that can be made locally and submitted back to the server for possible galaxy-wide integration."

"Naturally the Doc didn't want to use his precious 'Photons Be Free' so I ended up using Fair Haven. And I'm regretting it. The modifications are supposed to be by approval only and yet somehow they're all going through."

"Bloodwine at Sullivan's is fine, but Quark's dabo 'spin' is causing more trouble than it's worth. Not to mention all the security issues we're facing, inside and outside the holodeck. Think you can help us out?"
"Welcome to Sullivan's, what'll it be? Whiskey? Port? Bloodwine? Or perhaps you'd like to amuse yourself with our ring toss? Or maybe our dabo spin?"

"Well, Captain, whaddya think? I'm trying a little experiment. The Doc and I have been working on a holo server that hosts a holoprogram from one location, but allows modifications that can be made locally and submitted back to the server for possible galaxy-wide integration."

"Naturally the Doc didn't want to use his precious 'Photons Be Free' so I ended up using Fair Haven. And I'm regretting it. The modifications are supposed to be by approval only and yet somehow they're all going through."

"Bloodwine at Sullivan's is fine, but Quark's dabo 'spin' is causing more trouble than it's worth. Not to mention all the security issues we're facing, inside and outside the holodeck. Think you can help us out?"
"Tom! Harry! What manner of mischief are you two on about this time? One minute, I'm tending my flowers, the next, strange individuals are battling in the streets with massive blades."

"We're working on it, Maggie! Just a little longer. Captain, I hate to say it, but this technology might not be ready. I need to take Fair Haven offline and take it back to the way it used to be, but I can't!"

"Everything. Fair Haven's great! And the different versions are successful too! But the way I engineered the program, so that each user's interactions in their program can impact a more permanent version of the game, seems to be causing more problems than anticipated."

"Somehow the local versions of the program have worked their way into the computers of the ships they are on. I was trying to give the program access to all the power it could need and, well, I may have created a massive security issue in the process!"
"Captain, I told you that was confidential. If Captain Janeway finds out I spilled the beans about that, she might delete me!"
"Anyway, I can begin the process of shutting down on my end, but there are other aspects to resetting Fair Haven I'll need your help with. It might require some travel. Are you up for it?"
